ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: By Heaven with its oscillating orbits,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By the heaven with its numerous forms:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the decorated heaven.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By the heaven full of Hubuk,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: I swear by the heaven full of ways.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: By heaven with all its tracks
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: By the heaven full of paths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: by the heaven full of tracks,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the heaven full of paths.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: By the sky full of adornment [with stars],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By the Sky with (its) numerous Paths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: By the heaven full of paths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: By the heaven with its passages,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By the sky that is woven.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:7] And by the heaven with all its tracks (hubuk is the plural of habīka, similar [in pattern and meaning] to turuq, tarīqa, ‘paths’), that is to say, [by the heaven] that is created with tracks similar to tracks made in the sand,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (By the heaven full of paths) this is another oath; Allah swears by the seemly and beautiful heaven that has paths; it is also said that full of paths means: it has stars, the sun, the moon; and it is also said that full of paths means: full of waves like those of water upon being hit by the wind, or like the waves of sand upon being blown by the wind, or like the waves of curly hair or the waves of armour made of iron; and it is also said this refers to the seven heaven by which Allah has sworn.
